intro: Gomphocarpus gracilis, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, inflated seed pods. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is known for its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. Gomphocarpus gracilis is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
